data.title: Go to current file from viewing diff.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: latest
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. edit a file in a Git repo with VS Code
2. click the Git icon in the left well to see the diff. 

I often want to check the differences between two files, and then immediately go to the current working index of that file.  

expect: (something like) cmd+ right click on the current working index of a Git diff takes you to that file.

data.title: Picker: have a picker for folders that selects and expands in the explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

I would like to have a feature similar to "Go to File..." that instead of opening the file in the editor, it selects and expands the folder in the project tree view.

This would be useful in workspaces when you have to constantly changes folders and they are not close of each other.

![goto](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1139781/25966443/61fb728c-3661-11e7-8442-3bcc2c7b57e9.png)

data.title: Add setting to turn off the debugger peek UI

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run VSC debugger (I'm using it for nodejs)
2. Hit an unhandled exception that stops the debugger in some deep call stack.

Result:
Gigantic red call stack that is getting in the way of seeing the offending code.  It doesn't really hide the code, but it's a real nuisance.  I need to see the code not the callstack for a second time (I can already see the callstack on the left).

data.title: Imports using path aliases throwing error for
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: macOs 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup path alias in tsconfig
2. Import a file using path alias in a `.tsx` file
3. Get a `[ts] cannot find module...' error`

Works fine in a .ts file. Error is not present at compile time. 

.tsconfig
```
...
    "baseUrl": ".",
    "paths": {
      "SomePlace/*": [ "app/SomePlace/*" ]
    }
...
```

someFile.tsx 
```
import SomeThing from 'SomePlace/SomeThing'; // errors
```

someFile.ts
```
import SomeThing from 'SomePlace/SomeThing'; // no error
```

data.title: SCM diffs no longer open in preview mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|contextualduplicate|lafe|0.2.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make changes to a source controlled file (i.e. git)
2. Open diff viewer from source control tab

In previous versions of vscode, following the steps above would open the diff view in "preview mode", and the tab would only be "kept" (i.e. in the event that you open another preview tab) if you double click or edit. It seems that a change was made recently that makes diffs always open as kept tabs rather than previews, which makes reviewing changed files before staging bloat the editor with diff tabs that must be manually closed.
If this change was intended, I'd appreciate at least having a setting that I can use to prefer opening diffs in preview mode again.

data.title: Types info for 'Karma (Jasmine)' available only if 'karma.conf.js' is opened
data.body:
I have a JavaScript project without explicit *jsconfig.json* file. Type info for `describe`, `it`, etc.. becomes available only if I open *karma.conf.js* and then call 'Javascript: Reload Project' command. Closing *karma.conf.js* and repeated call of 'Reload Project' renders types unavailable. I've noticed that type info for native Node types (e.g. Buffer) are also loaded only after opening *karma.conf.js*

UPD: Type info is loaded if I have any opened '.js' file which is in the same directory as 'package.json' (in project root folder). I've created empty js file in project root, then called 'Reload Project' and types info became available.

Screncast attached:

![vscode_js_autotype_acquisition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24456989/25955777/d1caa766-3672-11e7-99b5-7581bda70da0.gif)

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

data.title: Go to definition doesn't work when a language server returns a text range that includes the current cursor position
data.body:
In the latest version of VSCode I see a strange behaviour occasionally when attempting to go to the definition of the identifier at the current cursor position. 

Based on the language server protocol a go-to-definition-request can be replied with a location or a range. If the current cursor position is inside the returned range then VSCode displays an error message saying "No definition found for X" instead of jumping to the start of that range. 

It has worked fine in previous releases.

data.title: Running foundation CLI in the integrated terminal
data.body:
I am getting a strange behavior when running 'foundation watch' and then 'foundation build' using the integrated terminal and foundation-cli. After running 'foundation watch' and then hitting Ctrl + C to quit the watch task, I then try to run 'foundation build' but instead of running that task, it keeps asking me 'Terminate batch job (y/n)?' The only way I can get it to work is if I quit VS code and restart it.
 
- VSCode Version:  1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run a Foundation 6 project using the integrated terminal and foundation-cli, line command 'foundation watch'
2. Then stop the watch task by hitting Ctrl + C and hitting Y.
3. Try to run 'foundation build'. It then keeps asking 'Terminate batch job (y/n)?' instead of running the build task.

data.title: Go To Implementation for React Components in JSX files no longer working
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

For JSX files 'Go To Implementation' no longer works from a React component in markup.  'Occasionally Go To Type' works. This has happened for everyone in my team, seemingly after a recent update.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Double click on the name of a React component (eg 'Button' for <Button >).
2. Use F12 or context menu for Go To Implementation.
3. 'No implementation for XXX found' is displayed.

|vscode-clearcase|OpenNingia|1.9.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.7.0|

|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|
|highlight-trailing-white-spaces|ybaumes|0.0.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Global search for something that has multiple matches across multiple files.
2. Use F4 to set through matches.
3. Edit the code in one of the files found by the match.
4. Press F4 again to go to next match. It returns to beginning of the list rather than continuing from last match. Note: The last match may have been deleted in the editing. Expect that it should continue from previous match to next available one.

data.title: Multiline copy paste from terminal is awful
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vagrant|bbenoist|0.4.0|
|file-templates|brpaz|1.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|gitlens|eamodio|2.12.2|
|tortoise-svn|fantasytyx|0.1.1|
|ansible|haaaad|0.2.5|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|spellchecker|swyphcosmo|1.2.9|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a program that outputs many lines (more than first in the window) in the terminal
2. Run it
3. Try to copy the output to paste somewhere (bug report, email)

Result:

* Drag selecting will not push scroll.
* Scrolling will deselect selection.

My work around is to use an external terminal, or to maximise the terminal, copy a section, paste, scroll, copy a section, paste and so on.

data.title: Case-preserving find and replace
Auto indentation doesn't preserve space
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy a struct definition ("Ctrl+C")
2. Paste it inside a function
3. Ask VSCode to indent the structure definition inside the function : Ctrl+K Ctrl+F

As illustrated in the animation, after the indentation, the white spaces between the type and the name of a field is not preserve, and so the alignement of the field names inside the structure definition doesn't exist anymore.
![peek 11-05-2017 14-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1025244/25948925/0464a036-3656-11e7-8d20-b771204f1f6f.gif)

What I except  from VSCode indentation is just to add the correct number of white spaces at the beginning of each lines of the structure definition.

A solution may be to add a keyword in the setting to ask VSCode to not modify the ending of lines to indent.
